text:
Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Patient continues to complain of back and abdominal pain, at times
   severe.
   Action:
   Chronic pain service consulted and recommendations made for meds. She
   was medicated with Oxycodone around the clock as well as Dilaudid for
   breakthrough pain.
   Response:
   Good effect from meds.
   Plan:
   Continue to assess pain control needs and medicate appropriately.
   Anxiety
   Assessment:
   Anxious at times but improved from yesterday
   Action:
   Following Psych recommendations patient was medicated around the clock
   with PO Ativan and Olanzapine. She was also encouraged to focus on
   other things such TV and given magazines to read. She was OOB to the
   chair and encouraged to interact with nursing staff.
   Response:
   Improved level of anxiety.
   Plan:
   Continue plan of care.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Continues on Cpap 5/5
   Action:
   Trach collar trials x2
   Response:
   Unable to tolerate trach collar each time due to desats to 80
   tachycardia and anxiety/agitation.
   Plan:
   Attempt trach collar trial in am. [**Hospital **] rehab screening in progress.
